Fadli Zon Sindir Buruknya Transparansi Keuangan BPJS Kesehatan
06 Nov 2019, 07:38 by Desi Yolanda Tarigan


Foto: Fadli Zon (Tsarina/detikcom)

Jakarta - Pemerintah menaikkan iuran BPJS Kesehatan hingga 100% pada 1 Januari 2020. Anggota DPR Fraksi Partai Gerindra mengkritisi langkah pemerintah tersebut.Dalam kultwitnya, Fadli Zon menyebutkan bahwa transparansi keuangan dari BPJS Kesehatan buruk. Sebab, kata Fadli Zon, BPJS Kesehatan belum memberikan laporan keuangan tahun 2018."Transparansi BPJS jg sangat buruk. Hingga hari ini BPJS belum mengunggah Laporan Tahunan dan Laporan Keuangan 2018, padahal ini bagian dari pertanggungjawaban publik. Dokumen laporan pengelolaan dana jaminan sosial mereka unggah terakhir adlh tahun 2017," ujar Fadli Zon.Tidak hanya itu, Fadli Zon juga menilai karena rendahnya transparansi tersebut masyarakat jadi tak mengetahui permasalahan yang terjadi pada BPJS Kesehatan, hingga akhirnya perusahaan harus menaikkan iuran bagi peserta."Kebijakan ini dirilis sebelum tuntutan transparansi, efisiensi, serta tata kelola kelembagaan yg bersih benar-benar ditunaikan BPJS. Sehingga, kita tak pernah benar-benar tahu, masalah yg diidap oleh BPJS ini masalah di kepesertaan, ataukah di tata kelola yg buruk," tuturnya.Fadli Zon juga menambahkan bahwa data base kepesertaan yang dimiliki oleh BPJS pun masih belum maksimal."Selain itu, data base kepesertaan BPJS juga belum optimal, krn masih ada temuan 27,44 juta data peserta bermasalah. Ini sebenarnya adalah masalah lama, tapi belum juga diselesaikan. BPJS seharusnya mempercepat proses 'data cleansing' kepesertaan ini," tambahnya.Simak Video "Keanggotaan BPJS Kesehatan 200 Lebih Ribu Warga Dinonaktifkan!"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

Fadli Zon Sindir Poor BPJS Health Financial Transparency
Nov 6, 2019, 07:38 by Desi Yolanda Tarigan


Photo: Fadli Zon (Tsarina / detikcom)

Jakarta - The government increased BPJS Health contributions by 100% on January 1, 2020. Members of the Gerindra Party faction criticized the government's move. In his cult, Fadli Zon stated that financial transparency from BPJS Health was poor. Because, said Fadli Zon, BPJS Health has not yet provided the 2018 financial report. "Transparency of the BPJS has also been very bad. To date BPJS has not uploaded the 2018 Annual Report and Financial Report, even though this is part of public accountability. The document on the management of their social security funds has been uploaded. The last was in 2017, "said Fadli Zon. Not only that, Fadli Zon also considered that because of the low transparency, the public did not know about the problems that occur at BPJS Health, so that the company finally had to increase fees for participants." This policy was released before transparency demands, efficiency, and clean institutional governance are actually carried out by BPJS. So, we never really know, the problems suffered by BPJS are problems in membership, or in bad governance, "he said. Fadli Zon also added that the data The membership base that is owned by BPJS is still not maximal. "In addition, the membership database of BPJS is also not yet optimal. not yet optimal, because there are still findings of 27.44 million problematic participant data. This is actually an old problem, but it hasn't been resolved. BPJS should speed up the process of 'data cleansing' of this membership, "he added.
